tasks.title: Computer Setup - Prepare development machine
tasks.description: Get a computer with at least 16GB RAM (32GB recommended), Install Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (dual boot or main OS), Learn basic Linux commands, Install VSCode or your preferred IDE, Set up GitHub account, Learn basic Git commands

tasks.title: Learning: Linux Command Line Basics
tasks.description: Complete "Linux Command Line Basics" - Free YouTube course, Practice on: https://www.learnenough.com/command-line-tutorial

tasks.title: Learning: Git Tutorial for Beginners
tasks.description: Complete "Git Tutorial for Beginners" - Free on YouTube, Practice basic Git commands

tasks.title: Project: Complete Linux command line tutorial
tasks.description: Practice navigating directories, creating files, using basic commands (ls, cd, mkdir, rm, cp, mv, grep, find). Checkpoint: Can you navigate directories, create files, and push to GitHub?

tasks.title: Project: Set up and push first repository to GitHub
tasks.description: Create GitHub account, initialize local repo, make commits, push to remote, create README

tasks.title: Programming Fundamentals - Learn basic programming concepts
tasks.description: Learn Variables, data types, operators, Control flow (if/else, loops), Functions and methods, Basic data structures (arrays, dictionaries), Object-oriented programming basics, Error handling. Start with Python 3.11+

tasks.title: Learning: Python for Beginners course
tasks.description: Complete "Python for Beginners" course, Install Python 3.11+, Use Codecademy: Learn Python 3 (free tier) or "Automate the Boring Stuff with Python" book

tasks.title: Practice: CodeWars exercises
tasks.description: Practice on: https://www.codewars.com (start with 8 kyu), Complete at least 20 beginner exercises

tasks.title: Project: Build Calculator
tasks.description: Create a calculator that can perform basic arithmetic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide)

tasks.title: Project: Build To-Do List
tasks.description: Create a command-line to-do list application with add, remove, list, and mark complete features

tasks.title: Project: Build File Organizer
tasks.description: Create a script that organizes files in a directory by extension into subdirectories

tasks.title: Project: Build Simple Web Scraper
tasks.description: Create a web scraper that extracts specific information from a website using requests and BeautifulSoup

tasks.title: Project: Build Password Generator
tasks.description: Create a password generator with customizable length and character sets

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Programming Fundamentals
tasks.description: Verify: Built all 5 projects and understand basic Python? Can explain OOP concepts? Can handle errors properly?

tasks.title: Networking Basics - Understand how computers communicate
tasks.description: Learn OSI Model (7 layers), TCP/IP Protocol suite, IP addresses (IPv4/IPv6), Ports and services, DNS basics, HTTP/HTTPS protocols, Common network tools (ping, traceroute, nslookup)

tasks.title: Learning: Network Fundamentals
tasks.description: Watch Professor Messer's Network+ videos (free on YouTube), Read "Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach" book chapters 1-3, Practice on: TryHackMe "Network Fundamentals" path

tasks.title: Project: Set up 2 VMs and make them communicate
tasks.description: Set up two virtual machines, configure networking, test connectivity, capture traffic with Wireshark, understand what you see

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Networking Basics
tasks.description: Verify: Can you explain how a web page loads from typing URL to seeing content? Understand OSI model? Can use network tools?

tasks.title: Security Concepts Foundation - Learn core security principles
tasks.description: Learn CIA Triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability), Authentication vs Authorization, Encryption basics (symmetric, asymmetric), Hashing vs Encryption, Digital signatures, SSL/TLS handshake, Common attack types overview

tasks.title: Day 1-2: CIA Triad and basic principles
tasks.description: Study CIA Triad in depth, Learn security principles, Understand confidentiality, integrity, availability concepts

tasks.title: Day 3-4: Cryptography fundamentals
tasks.description: Learn symmetric encryption, asymmetric encryption, hashing algorithms, digital signatures, key management

tasks.title: Day 5-6: Authentication mechanisms
tasks.description: Study authentication methods, password security, multi-factor authentication, session management

tasks.title: Day 7-8: Common vulnerabilities overview
tasks.description: Study OWASP Top 10, Common attack vectors, Vulnerability types, Impact assessment

tasks.title: Day 9-10: Security frameworks
tasks.description: Learn NIST framework basics, ISO 27001 basics, Security control frameworks

tasks.title: Day 11-14: Practice labs and review
tasks.description: Complete practice labs, Review all concepts, Take practice quizzes, Prepare for next phase

tasks.title: Learning: CompTIA Security+
tasks.description: Watch Professor Messer free videos for CompTIA Security+, Study security concepts

tasks.title: Learning: Cybrary Introduction to IT & Cybersecurity
tasks.description: Complete Cybrary: Introduction to IT & Cybersecurity course

tasks.title: Learning: OWASP Top 10 documentation
tasks.description: Read OWASP Top 10 documentation thoroughly, Understand each vulnerability type

tasks.title: Project: Set up home lab with VirtualBox
tasks.description: Install VirtualBox, create Kali Linux VM, install vulnerable VM (Metasploitable, DVWA), practice basic network scanning

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Security Concepts Foundation
tasks.description: Verify: Can you explain common attacks and basic defense mechanisms? Understand CIA Triad? Know encryption basics?

tasks.title: Web Application Security - Week 1: SQL Injection
tasks.description: Learn how databases work, SQL basics (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE), SQL injection techniques, Prevention methods. Practice on DVWA

tasks.title: Learning: How databases work
tasks.description: Study database fundamentals, SQL queries, Database structure, Relational databases

tasks.title: Learning: SQL basics
tasks.description: Master SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE statements, WHERE clauses, JOINs, Subqueries

tasks.title: Learning: SQL injection techniques
tasks.description: Study union-based injection, error-based injection, blind SQL injection, time-based injection, second-order injection

tasks.title: Learning: SQL injection prevention
tasks.description: Learn parameterized queries, input validation, least privilege, WAF rules, secure coding practices

tasks.title: Project: Complete DVWA all levels for SQL injection
tasks.description: Practice SQL injection on DVWA (Damn Vulnerable Web Application) across all difficulty levels: Low, Medium, High, Impossible

tasks.title: Practice: TryHackMe SQL Injection room
tasks.description: Complete TryHackMe SQL Injection room, Practice different injection techniques

tasks.title: Web Application Security - Week 2: XSS and CSRF
tasks.description: Learn JavaScript basics (DOM manipulation), Reflected vs Stored vs DOM XSS, CSRF attack mechanics, Prevention (CSP, tokens). Practice on XSS game

tasks.title: Learning: JavaScript basics for security
tasks.description: Study DOM manipulation, Event handlers, JavaScript execution context, Browser security model

tasks.title: Learning: XSS types
tasks.description: Study Reflected XSS, Stored XSS, DOM-based XSS, Mutation XSS, Blind XSS

tasks.title: Learning: CSRF attack mechanics
tasks.description: Understand CSRF attack flow, Token-based protection, SameSite cookies, Referer header validation

tasks.title: Learning: XSS and CSRF prevention
tasks.description: Study Content Security Policy (CSP), CSRF tokens, Input sanitization, Output encoding, Secure headers

tasks.title: Project: Solve XSS challenges on XSS game
tasks.description: Complete all levels of Google XSS game, understand different XSS types and exploitation techniques

tasks.title: Practice: PortSwigger XSS labs
tasks.description: Complete PortSwigger Web Security Academy XSS labs, Practice all XSS types

tasks.title: Practice: PortSwigger CSRF labs
tasks.description: Complete PortSwigger Web Security Academy CSRF labs, Practice CSRF exploitation and prevention

tasks.title: Web Application Security - Week 3: Authentication & Access Control
tasks.description: Learn Session management, JWT tokens, OAuth 2.0 basics, Password security, Multi-factor authentication. Practice on PortSwigger Academy

tasks.title: Learning: Session management
tasks.description: Study session creation, session storage, session fixation, session hijacking, secure session handling

tasks.title: Learning: JWT tokens
tasks.description: Understand JWT structure, JWT signing, JWT validation, JWT vulnerabilities, Secure JWT implementation

tasks.title: Learning: OAuth 2.0 basics
tasks.description: Study OAuth 2.0 flow, Authorization codes, Access tokens, Refresh tokens, OAuth vulnerabilities

tasks.title: Learning: Password security
tasks.description: Study password hashing (bcrypt, Argon2), Password policies, Password reset flows, Account lockout mechanisms

tasks.title: Learning: Multi-factor authentication
tasks.description: Study MFA types (SMS, TOTP, hardware tokens), MFA implementation, MFA bypass techniques, MFA best practices

tasks.title: Project: Complete PortSwigger Academy free labs
tasks.description: Complete beginner and intermediate labs on PortSwigger Web Security Academy: Authentication, Access control, JWT, OAuth

tasks.title: Practice: Try 10 easy boxes on HackTheBox
tasks.description: Complete 10 easy boxes on HackTheBox, Focus on web application vulnerabilities, Document findings

tasks.title: Mini-Project: Build vulnerable web app and fix it
tasks.description: Create a simple blog with SQL injection vulnerability, exploit it yourself, fix the vulnerability, document the process

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Web Application Security
tasks.description: Verify: Successfully exploited and fixed 5 different vulnerability types? Understand authentication mechanisms? Can identify web vulnerabilities?

tasks.title: Network Security & Pentesting - Week 1: Reconnaissance
tasks.description: Learn Passive reconnaissance (OSINT), Active reconnaissance (scanning), Learn Nmap thoroughly, Service fingerprinting, OS detection, Vulnerability scanning basics

tasks.title: Learning: Passive reconnaissance (OSINT)
tasks.description: Study OSINT techniques, Google dorking, Social media reconnaissance, Domain information gathering, Subdomain enumeration

tasks.title: Learning: Active reconnaissance (scanning)
tasks.description: Study network scanning techniques, Port scanning methods, Service enumeration, Banner grabbing

tasks.title: Learning: Nmap thoroughly
tasks.description: Master Nmap syntax, Scan types (TCP, UDP, SYN, ACK), NSE scripts, Advanced Nmap options, Nmap output interpretation

tasks.title: Learning: Service fingerprinting
tasks.description: Study service version detection, Protocol identification, Application fingerprinting, Service enumeration techniques

tasks.title: Learning: OS detection
tasks.description: Study OS fingerprinting techniques, TCP/IP stack fingerprinting, OS detection tools, OS detection evasion

tasks.title: Learning: Vulnerability scanning basics
tasks.description: Study vulnerability scanners (Nessus, OpenVAS), CVE databases, Vulnerability assessment methodology, False positive handling

tasks.title: Project: Nmap Mastery - Scan home network
tasks.description: Scan your home network, try all scan types, use NSE scripts, parse and understand output, document findings

tasks.title: Practice: TryHackMe Nmap room
tasks.description: Complete TryHackMe Nmap room, Practice all scan types, Use NSE scripts

tasks.title: Learning: "Nmap Network Scanning" official book
tasks.description: Read "Nmap Network Scanning" official book (free PDF), Study advanced techniques

tasks.title: Network Security - Week 2: Exploitation Basics
tasks.description: Learn Metasploit Framework introduction, Exploit vs payload concepts, Basic exploit techniques, Post-exploitation basics, Privilege escalation overview

tasks.title: Learning: Metasploit Framework introduction
tasks.description: Install Metasploit, Understand Metasploit architecture, Learn msfconsole, Basic commands, Module types

tasks.title: Learning: Exploit vs payload concepts
tasks.description: Understand exploit modules, Payload types, Encoders, NOPs, Handlers

tasks.title: Learning: Basic exploit techniques
tasks.description: Study exploit selection, Exploit execution, Payload generation, Session management

tasks.title: Learning: Post-exploitation basics
tasks.description: Study meterpreter basics, File system access, Network pivoting, Data exfiltration, Persistence

tasks.title: Learning: Privilege escalation overview
tasks.description: Study Windows privilege escalation, Linux privilege escalation, Kernel exploits, Misconfigurations

tasks.title: Project: Metasploit Practice - Exploit Metasploitable VM
tasks.description: Try 5 different exploits on Metasploitable VM, understand payload options, practice post-exploitation, document process

tasks.title: Learning: Metasploit Unleashed
tasks.description: Complete Metasploit Unleashed (free course), Study all modules, Practice exercises

tasks.title: Practice: TryHackMe Metasploit room
tasks.description: Complete TryHackMe Metasploit room, Practice exploitation, Practice post-exploitation

tasks.title: Network Security - Week 3: Network Defense
tasks.description: Learn Firewall configuration, IDS/IPS setup (Snort/Suricata), Log analysis basics, Incident detection, Network segmentation

tasks.title: Learning: Firewall configuration
tasks.description: Study firewall types, Firewall rules, NAT configuration, DMZ setup, Firewall best practices

tasks.title: Learning: IDS/IPS setup (Snort/Suricata)
tasks.description: Study IDS vs IPS, Snort installation, Suricata installation, Rule writing, Alert management

tasks.title: Learning: Log analysis basics
tasks.description: Study log types, Log aggregation, Log parsing, Log analysis tools, SIEM basics

tasks.title: Learning: Incident detection
tasks.description: Study threat indicators, Anomaly detection, Alert correlation, Incident response basics

tasks.title: Learning: Network segmentation
tasks.description: Study VLANs, Subnetting, Network isolation, Zero trust principles, Segmentation best practices

tasks.title: Project: Network Defense - Set up pfSense and Snort
tasks.description: Set up pfSense firewall VM, configure Snort IDS, generate alerts, analyze Snort logs, document configuration

tasks.title: Practice: TryHackMe Network Security room
tasks.description: Complete TryHackMe Network Security room, Practice defense techniques

tasks.title: Mini-Project: Home Network Security Assessment
tasks.description: Map your home network, identify all devices, scan for vulnerabilities, create a security report, implement improvements

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Network Security & Pentesting
tasks.description: Verify: Can you scan, enumerate, and exploit a vulnerable system? Understand network defense? Can use Metasploit?

tasks.title: Linux & System Administration - Week 1: Linux Essentials
tasks.description: Learn File operations (cp, mv, rm, find, grep), Permissions (chmod, chown, ACLs), Process management (ps, top, kill), Network commands (ifconfig, netstat, ss), Service management (systemctl)

tasks.title: Learning: File operations
tasks.description: Master cp, mv, rm, find, grep, locate, which, whereis, file operations, text processing

tasks.title: Learning: Permissions
tasks.description: Study chmod, chown, ACLs, umask, sticky bits, SUID/SGID, file permissions, directory permissions

tasks.title: Learning: Process management
tasks.description: Study ps, top, htop, kill, killall, pkill, jobs, fg, bg, nohup, process priorities

tasks.title: Learning: Network commands
tasks.description: Master ifconfig, ip, netstat, ss, route, arp, ping, traceroute, dig, nslookup

tasks.title: Learning: Service management
tasks.description: Study systemctl, service, systemd, init scripts, service status, service logs, service dependencies

tasks.title: Project: Install Ubuntu Server and configure via CLI
tasks.description: Install Ubuntu Server (no GUI), configure everything via command line, set up SSH server, configure firewall (ufw/iptables), set up log rotation, schedule tasks with cron

tasks.title: Learning: "The Linux Command Line" by William Shotts
tasks.description: Read "The Linux Command Line" by William Shotts (free PDF), Complete exercises

tasks.title: Practice: Linux Journey website
tasks.description: Complete Linux Journey website tutorials, Practice all concepts

tasks.title: Practice: OverTheWire Bandit wargame
tasks.description: Complete OverTheWire: Bandit wargame, Practice Linux commands, Practice security concepts

tasks.title: Practice: TryHackMe Linux Fundamentals
tasks.description: Complete TryHackMe Linux Fundamentals path, Practice all Linux concepts

tasks.title: Linux - Week 2: Bash Scripting
tasks.description: Learn Variables and loops, Conditional statements, Functions, Text processing (sed, awk, cut), File operations in scripts, Error handling

tasks.title: Learning: Bash scripting basics
tasks.description: Study variables, arrays, loops (for, while), conditionals (if/else), functions, parameters

tasks.title: Learning: Text processing
tasks.description: Master sed, awk, cut, grep, sort, uniq, tr, paste, join, text manipulation

tasks.title: Learning: File operations in scripts
tasks.description: Study file reading, file writing, file manipulation, directory operations, file testing

tasks.title: Learning: Error handling
tasks.description: Study exit codes, error checking, trap command, set -e, set -u, error logging

tasks.title: Project: Create 5 Bash scripts
tasks.description: Build: System monitoring script (CPU, memory, disk), Log analyzer for failed SSH attempts, Automated backup script, Port scanner in bash, File integrity checker

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Linux & System Administration
tasks.description: Verify: Comfortable working entirely in Linux terminal? Can write bash scripts? Understand system administration?

tasks.title: Security Certifications Preparation - eJPT or Security+
tasks.description: Choose eJPT (more practical, ~$200) or Security+ (more comprehensive, ~$370). Study 2-3 hours daily, watch all video lectures, take detailed notes, complete practice questions, do hands-on labs, take practice exams, schedule and take certification

tasks.title: Option A: eJPT Preparation
tasks.description: Focus: Hands-on penetration testing. Study: INE eJPT course materials. Practice: TryHackMe, HackTheBox. Cost: ~$200

tasks.title: Option B: Security+ Preparation
tasks.description: Focus: Broad security concepts. Study: Professor Messer videos + practice tests. Practice: CompTIA CertMaster Practice. Cost: ~$370

tasks.title: Certification: Take practice exams
tasks.description: Take multiple practice exams, Review weak areas, Focus on hands-on labs, Prepare for exam format

tasks.title: Certification: Schedule and take exam
tasks.description: Schedule certification exam, Take exam, Pass certification, Update resume

tasks.title: Checkpoint: Security Certifications
tasks.description: Verify: Passed certification exam? Understand security concepts? Ready for next phase?
